intro: Psilocaulon mucronulatum, commonly known as the sharp-pointed psilocaulon, is a unique member of the Acanthaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks or in humid forest understories. Its flowers are often visited by pollinators like bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological role in its native habitat. Due to its ornamental value and habitat specificity, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
